definition: A preposition commonly used to indicate the reason or cause behind an action or situation. It is often employed to express the motive or purpose for something, or to denote the basis or grounds for a decision.

examples.german: Wegen des schlechten Wetters sind wir zu Hause geblieben.
examples.english: We stayed at home because of the bad weather.

examples.german: Wegen dir habe ich den Zug verpasst!
examples.english: Because of you, I missed the train!

examples.german: Wegen der hohen Nachfrage sind die Tickets ausverkauft.
examples.english: Due to high demand, the tickets are sold out.

examples.german: Wegen seiner Krankheit konnte er nicht arbeiten.
examples.english: He couldn't work because of his illness.
